definition: to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit

sentences.english: Eva: Don't underestimate him. He's known as the father of modern sniping .
sentences.chinese: 不要小瞧他，他可被誉为现代狙击之父。

sentences.english: Don't look down upon the old employees, sometimes dry than young people.
sentences.chinese: 千万别小瞧老员工，有时候会干的比年轻人更出色。

sentences.english: He could not stand other people looking down at him.
sentences.chinese: 他不能忍受别人小瞧他。

sentences.english: She is only ten, but you must not misjudge her.
sentences.chinese: 她才十岁，但决不能小瞧她。

sentences.english: Child as Tom is, you cant look down upon him.
sentences.chinese: 尽管汤姆还是个孩子，你可不能小瞧他。

definition: to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself
to show respect for/to think highly of
to be carried away by one's wishful thinking (idiom)/to labor under a delusion/wishful thinking
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
